arm_group.arm_group_label: pregnant women between 19-30 weeks gestational age

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators will follow up on babies that had prenatal diagnosis at 2nd or 3rd
      trimester of normal width and asymetry of lateral brain ventricles

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Babies With Asymetry of Lateral Brain Ventricles
clinical_study.condition: Lateral Ventricles of Fetuses at Mid Trimester

detailed_description.textblock:
Women who will attend 2nd or 3rd ultrasound prenatal scans will be included. Women where the
      fetus would be diagnosed with lateral ventricles that are normal width (<10 m"m) but
      discrepacy of >3 m"m will be followed up after delivery by head ultrasound and neurologic
      exam

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy pregnant women between 19-30 weeks gestational age and asymetry of lateral
             ventricles

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lateral ventricles >10 m"m

study_pop.textblock:
women at 19-30 weeks who attend ultrasound exam and diagnosed with asymetry of lateral
        brain ventricles.

intervention.arm_group_label: pregnant women between 19-30 weeks gestational age

clinical_study.official_title: Outcome of Babies With Asymetry of Lateral Brain Ventricles

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will follow up on brain ultrasound of babies with normal width discrepant lateral brain ventricles

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: After delivery, a neurologic examination will be carried out on all babies with discrepant but normal lateral ventricles
secondary_outcome.measure: Neurologic examination of babies with discrepant but normal lateral ventricles

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
